thread.title: Maria Menounos Lost Diamond on Engagement Ring at Super Bowl
thread.title_full: Maria Menounos Lost Diamond on Engagement Ring at Super Bowl

author: Karen Mizoguchi
title: Maria Menounos Lost Diamond on Engagement Ring at Super Bowl
text:
The Howard Stern Show; Inset: AKM-GSI 
Being a diehard Patriots superfan can result in losing more than just your voice. 
Days after her favorite NFL team won Super Bowl LI , Maria Menounos revealed that she may have celebrated too hard at NRG Stadium as a small diamond on her custom engagement ring came off. 
The E! News host, who got engaged to fiancé Keven Undergaro in March, took to Instagram and Twitter on Wednesday to share video proof of how her excitement got the best of her ring. 
“ Soo…@tombrady lost his #superbowl51 jersey & I lost my diamond & my voice ..super fandom costs !!! @undergaro was horrified! This video is like 5 seconds of the evidence..I did this hmmm like the entire 4th quarter to get #patriots fans cheering. Oooops!” Menounos, 38, explained in her caption. A video posted by maria menounos (@mariamenounos) on Feb 8, 2017 at 2:31pm PST A photo posted by Keven Undergaro (@undergaro) on Feb 5, 2017 at 11:58am PST 
As for replacing the missing diamond, the bride-to-be isn’t exactly rushing to get the Jean Dousset-designed bling fixed. 
“I might wait until I bang my hands on a few more metal boards at another game because I think the Patriots will be right back there again next year,” she told E! News . “I think I learned my lesson, and when I have to be a superfan I’ll just wear it around my neck or something because this is going to be an expensive habit being a big sports fan.” 
In March, Dousset told PeopleStyle that the ring was custom-created for Menounos, after working with Undergaro for over a month. “We had a limited amount of time and worked together closely to create the perfect ring for Maria,” Dousset shared. Show Full Article
